articles.title: The Skill Developers Are Losing in the AI Era
articles.excerpt: AI writes code faster than ever. But the skill it's quietly eroding ‚Äî codebase navigation ‚Äî is the one that matters most for production work.

articles.title: Why Vibe Coding Without Architecture Is Dangerous
articles.excerpt: Generating code is easy. Generating code that fits into a production system without breaking contracts? That's the hard part.

articles.title: AI Didn't Replace Engineering ‚Äî It Raised the Bar
articles.excerpt: The developers who thrive in the AI era aren't the ones generating the most code. They're the ones who understand the systems they're changing.

articles.title: How to Estimate Blast Radius Before Touching a Line of Code
articles.excerpt: Every change ripples. The question is how far. Learn the mental model for estimating impact before you make a single edit.

articles.title: Contracts Over Code: The Real Structure of Large Systems
articles.excerpt: Functions come and go. What persists are the contracts between components ‚Äî the promises they make to each other.

articles.title: How to Navigate a Codebase Without AI (And Why You Should)
articles.excerpt: Before you ask AI for help, you should be able to find your way through any codebase using VS Code's built-in tools.

articles.title: The Prompt Framework I Use to Prevent AI Hallucinations
articles.excerpt: AI hallucinations aren't random ‚Äî they're what happens when AI doesn't have enough context. Here's how to fix that.

articles.title: Why Asking AI for Full Rewrites Is a Rookie Mistake
articles.excerpt: The instinct to say 'rewrite this file' is strong. It's also the fastest way to introduce bugs you can't trace.

articles.title: Diff-Based AI Coding: A Safer Workflow
articles.excerpt: Instead of accepting whole files from AI, learn to work in diffs ‚Äî verifying every change line by line before it ships.

articles.title: The Future Developer Is an Architect, Not a Typist
articles.excerpt: When AI handles the typing, the developer's job shifts to the thinking ‚Äî understanding systems, defining scope, and verifying correctness.
